noun.description: A paper or cardboard container, typically one in which goods are packed to be sold.
examples: sow seeds 2 to 3 inches apart or as recommended on the seed packets

noun.description: A ship traveling at regular intervals between two ports, originally for the conveyance of mail.
A block of data transmitted across a network.

verb.description: Make up into or wrap up in a packet.
examples: packet a basket of take-out and head for Gooseberry Beach

origin: Mid 16th century: diminutive of pack, perhaps from Anglo-Norman French; compare with Anglo-Latin paccettum.
